title: Mustafa Peštalić
text:
Mustafa Peštalić (born 28 March 1963) is a Bosnian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager and former goalkeeper who played in several clubs in Yugoslavia, Portugal and Hong Kong.
Playing career.
Club.
Born in <a href="Br%C4%8Dko">Brčko</a>, <a href="SR%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">SR Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>, back then still part of Yugoslavia, he started playing in local side <a href="FK%20Lokomotiva%20Br%C4%8Dko">FK Lokomotiva Brčko</a> before moving to <a href="Yugoslav%20First%20League">Yugoslav First League</a> side <a href="FK%20Vojvodina">FK Vojvodina</a> in 1982. However, in two seasons he managed to make only 5 league appearances deciding then to move to <a href="Yugoslav%20Second%20League">Yugoslav Second League</a> side <a href="FK%20Spartak%20Subotica">FK Spartak Subotica</a> where he became a regular. After 2 seasons in Subotica, he played another 2 with same level side <a href="HNK%20%C5%A0ibenik">HNK Šibenik</a>, before moving in 1988 to <a href="FK%20Sloboda%20Tuzla">FK Sloboda Tuzla</a> making this way a return to the Yugoslav top-flight. After two seasons in Tuzla, he played with <a href="FK%20Vele%C5%BE%20Mostar">FK Velež Mostar</a> before leaving Yugoslavia in 1991.
In summer 1991 he joined Portuguese side <a href="C.F.%20Estrela%20da%20Amadora">C.F. Estrela da Amadora</a>, and for he next 6 years he will play in Portugal with <a href="S.C.%20Campomaiorense">S.C. Campomaiorense</a>, <a href="C.F.%20Uni%C3%A3o%20de%20Lamas">C.F. União de Lamas</a> and <a href="A.D.%20Camacha">A.D. Camacha</a>. He left Portugal in 1997 and joined <a href="Sing%20Tao%20SC">Sing Tao SC</a> playing in the Hong Kong Division 1 and stayed in the club until 1999 when the club was dissolved.
Post-playing career.
After retiring, he became a coach. By February 2012 he was a goalkeeping coach at FK Spartak Subotica in the <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Serbian SuperLiga</a>. Afterwards, he became sports director of <a href="NK%20Zvijezda%20Grada%C4%8Dac">NK Zvijezda Gradačac</a> (a club playing in the <a href="Bosnian%20Premier%20League">Bosnian Premier League</a>, a post he held until April 2014.
